article.title: A nested polyhedra model of isotropic MHD turbulence

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of spectrum is displayed by both kinetic and magnetic energies in Figure 1?
What is the effect of decreasing the dissipation value (v) in the nested polyhedra model, as shown in Figure 2?
choices: The dissipative range is pushed outside the simulation domain.

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the energy spectra when the magnetic Prandtl number (Prm) is decreased significantly, as depicted in Figure 3?
choices: A secondary range appears where magnetic energy is dissipated, and kinetic energy follows k-8/3.
Both kinetic and magnetic energy spectra retain the k-5/3 scaling.
Equipartition of energy between kinetic and magnetic components is no longer observed.

multiple_choice_question.text: What scaling law does the equipartition time (δτk) approximately follow with respect to the wavenumber (k), as illustrated in Figure 5?
